intro: Abalemis, commonly known as the African orchid. It is a genus of flowering plants in the orchid family, Orchidaceae, native to southern Africa. The plants are characterized by their showy, often fragrant flowers that come in a variety of colors. Abalemis species typically grow as epiphytes or lithophytes, attaching themselves to trees or rocks. They require specific environmental conditions to thrive, including high humidity and indirect light.
